results.title: Seven (Captioned) (D)
results.creator_credit: David Fincher, Phyllis Carlyle, Arnold Kopelson and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A serial killer is murdering people according to a deranged righteous rationale, punishing people for their indulgence in the seven deadly sins. Morgan Freeman is Detective Somerset, a police officer who has seen too much crime and has witnessed for too long the savagery of a decaying urban world. Brad Pitt is young Detective Mills, eager to prove his abilities and excited to have landed a fascinating if gruesome case. “Seven” is a film that portrays an almost misanthropic contempt for the contemporary world; a world in which spirituality is infused with vengeance and where relationships are tainted by exploitation. The nameless city is always dark and wet, and begins to resemble a vision of Hell. “Seven” includes stunning photography, electrifying editing and a meticulous soundtrack. The film confronts the viewer with the hateful extremeties of evil. It remains unforgettable because it also suggests that evil is not the prerogative of monsters. Co-starring Gwyneth Paltrow and a diabolically good Kevin Spacey. Do not miss the opening credit sequence.

results.title: Seve Ballesteros: the short game
results.brief_description: Seve Ballesteros is undoubtedly the greatest continental golfer. His remarkable ability to imagine and perform miraculous shots has placed him on a level above the rest. Seve’s easy instructional program is designed to help improve your game from 100 yards and in, enabling you to polish your techniques. Focuses on fundamentals like the grip, stance and alignment, chipping, putting and associated skills to help achieve success in the short game.

results.title: Settlers in a far, far land: Muslims in Australia
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This program looks at the two important links that Australia has established with the Middle East, settlers and trade. Afghan camel drivers, who opened up the outback and built the first mosques, were among the first Muslims who arrived in Australia last century. The eighties witnessed a new wave of Muslim settlers from Arab and Asian countries who established Islamic schools to ensure that their children maintained their Islamic values and traditions. This program also looks at the meat trade that Australia has developed with the Middle East exporting meat that has been slaughtered according to the religious requirements of Islam. NB: DEPICTS THE SLAUGHTER OF ANIMALS AT AN ABATTOIR.

results.title: Settlement Soccer Club
results.brief_description: Gene started a Friday afternoon soccer game at the Inverloch Community Hub, in south-eastern Victoria, and invited some young people from the Settlement communities to share in their love of the world game. ‘The Settlement Soccer Club’ is about connecting with others in the community and breaking down boundaries with the international language of the beautiful game. Anyone is welcome to play.

results.title: Settle down country (A)
results.creator_credit: Pam Nathan, Jim Buckell, David Batty, NAIHO, CAAMA, CAAC and Western Deserts Oustations Council
results.brief_description: Documents the return of the Pintubi people to their own lands after many years on Government run settlements. Extensive use of archival footage offers an added historical perspective to this account of the efforts of these people to retain their cultural heritage. Based on the book of the same name by Dick Leichleitner Japanangka and Pam Nathan.

results.title: Setting up an overseas post
results.creator_credit: Robert Kingsbury, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Explains the preliminary work involved in establishing an Australian diplomatic post abroad and the nature and value of a High Commissioner’s or Ambassador’s duties. A training film for cadet diplomats on the problems and procedures of establishing contact with a foreign nation.

results.title: Setting the stage for learning (TEFC): teaching the 3's, 4's and 5's
results.brief_description: An experiment in which children are urged to play in a sandbox without tools or toys, only sand, is contrasted with familiar situations in which teachers offer rich learning experiences.

results.title: Setting the scene: virtual spaces (Roger Ford and Owen Paterson)
results.brief_description: A co-production between AFTRS and ACMI for ACMI’s Setting the Scene exhibition. Interviews with two Australian production designers with a focus on creating virtual worlds. Roger Ford talks about the role of a production designer on a production and his experience of creating computer-designed sets from Babe to The Chronicles of Narnia : Prince Caspian. Owen Paterson discusses his work on Speed Racer and the Matrix and creating digital worlds.
